logicCircuitBuilder
Class Device

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JLabel
                  logicCircuitBuilder.Device
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
AndGate, ExnorGate, LedDevice, NandGate, NorGate, NotGate, OrGate, Vcc_GND, XorGate
public abstract class Device
extends javax.swing.JLabel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener

Device is any of the devices available to be implemented in the circuit. The device queries its input which in turn queries the output connected to it.

Author:
vega
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Device

public Device(java.lang.String name,
              int inno,
              int outno,
              java.awt.Component parent)
Creates a device

Parameters:
name - The name of the device to be created
inno - the number of inputs in the device
outno - the number of outputs in the device
parent - the panel in which the device is created. Here the CircuitPanel is given. This allows the device to call the functions of the CircuitPanel.
Method Detail

deviceFunction

public abstract void deviceFunction()
Implements the logic of the device. Every device will override this function in order to implement its logic.

mouseDragged

public void mouseDragged(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
Implements the device drag operation The mouse coordinates are obtained and the device is set at the new location using the setLocation() function.

Specified by:
mouseDragged in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener

mouseMoved

public void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent arg0)
Sets the cursor to a crosshair when it is over the input and output connectors for easy identification by the user. Else sets the cursor to the default cursor.

Specified by:
mouseMoved in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
